name: Chapel Apartments

reviews.text: We have stayed in Chapel Apartments three times now with 2 other couples attending sporting events in Dunedin. They have to rate as good as any place we have stayed anywhere, this also includes overseas as well. It offers perfect location, but most importantly all the necessary facilities are provided along with a spacious layout, comfortable beds and relaxing living area. All this combined presents a lodging that can only be described as up market. Surprisingly the cost is very reasonable for what you get. We can highly recommend Chapel Apartments for a stay in Dunedin. G & B Sthld
reviews.title: Accommodation at the top end

reviews.text: I stayed at Chapel Apartments for almost 2 weeks whilst attending a course. It was exactly what I needed - comfortable, roomy, clean, safe.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: It has fantastic facilities - fully functional kitchen (microwave/oven, stove, dishwasher), washing machine, Internet.
reviews.title: Awesome venue for a family or something a bit different

reviews.text: Location is very convenient, with cafes, supermarkets and restaurants at your doorstep.
reviews.title: Special experience
Booking system a joke
reviews.text: Jon and Angela were wonderful hosts - always happy to help and keen to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Stayed here for 4 nights. Great place to stay. Handy to central city and restaurants. Apartments were clean, warm (esp heated floors) and good sized. Full kitchen and laundry are bonus when travelling with family. Rooms are a little dark due to the nature of the building (which Jon the friendly/helpful owner explained to us).
reviews.title: Central location in unique building

reviews.text: Overall a great stay and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Great apartment for two couples wanting a super central, super convenient, and very well equipped place to stay in Dunedin. Not sure why other reviewers have complained about it being cold? We were there in freezing weather and the heat pump worked a treat, the bathroom floors are heated, and the beds have electric balnkets. Highly recommend this place. The only tiny niggle is the lack of window view to the outside, hard to know what to wear in the morning by appraising a sliver of sky. However the decor making the most of what is left of the old church is very appealing, andprobably hard to work around to make large windows.
reviews.title: So central yet super quiet apartments

reviews.text: With my eldest off to Otago Uni next year, we decided to do a recon trip to check it all out. It's been 20+ years since I was last in Dunedin and I have to say, what a beautiful city! We were delighted with the 2-bedroom apartment we booked, and with Jon's attentive service - we'd definitely stay again. The location of the Chapel Apartments were what drew us to book, and I confess to usually taking a large handful of salt when viewing photos of any accommodation posted online, but the photos on Jon's own website are totally accurate. It's the little things that impress me... the heated floors in both bathrooms, the uplighting on the beautiful internal stone wall and the oh so comfy beds.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Being central meant we were 200m or so from the middle of town, the theatres, pubs, cafes and shops. Not to mention easy walking distance to the Uni, Library, Museum, and most Halls. We were really pleased with the location and surprised at how quiet our apartment was. Once inside we weren't bothered by street, traffic or people noise at all.
reviews.title: Winter stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights, the apartments are large, comfortable and well appointed. A few things could have made our stay much better, there was no parking really for our apartment and we were told to park in apartment 1 car park by the owner, only to have a note on our door to move to the paid parking across the street, and we would be reimbursed. Also we didn't see any staff members at all during our stay, only whom may have been the cleaner, no one to check us in, just our name written on a whiteboard. There was quite a bit of noise coming from the apartment next door as well which kept us up. These apartments would be great for families but I don't think I would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice apartments but a few things let it down

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed in a 3-bedroom apartment at the end of our South island tour. The apartments have been tastfully renovated to a high standard and have everything you need for a comfortable stay. The apartment was very spacious and modern. Note that the apartments are not serviced daily so you need to be prepared to make your own beds and clean up as you go.
reviews.title: High quality apartments

reviews.text: The only minor problem we had was that the bedrooms facing the side street only had venetian blinds which do not keep out the light. The streetlights outside made the bedrooms as bright as day and the occupants had difficulty sleeping. Suggest bringing eyeshades (like they supply on airplanes) if staying in these rooms. Apart from that it was great.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: 10 of us visited Dunedin in October and stayed at The Chapel Apartments for 3 nights - 3 couples in a 3 bedroom and 2 couples in a 2 bedroom apartment. We all LOVED our accommodation!! Both apartments were quite newly renovated to a very high standard. Very modern with all you'd possibly need for a short stay and beautifully decorated. The beds were all extremely comfortable, the bathrooms quite luxurious and everything was exceptionally clean. A perfect location close to everything!!! Would most definitely stay there again!!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay! Top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the chapel apartments for one evening on a 3 week tour of New Zealand. Booked a two bedroom apartment and were truly impressed with all aspects of the apartment. The location was superb and the apartment itself was renovated to a very high standard. The apartment was spacious and had a luxurious feel throughout. If we had known in advance we would have stayed longer and will go back.
reviews.title: Why splash out on a hotel room when you can have an apartment with everything you need?

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment. As soon as we arrived we were immediately enchanted with the build of the apartments inside an old church. The apartment itself is excellent, very well maintained and equipped. Free wi-fi. Jon was very helpful and ensured that we were well looked after. Located just 5 minutes walk from the Octagon in the centre of Dunedin.
reviews.title: Delightful apartments inside a converted church

reviews.text: Originally booked into the Chapel Apartment in central Dunedin, our booking was cancelled by the owner due to a long staying tenant. This was highly inconvenient, as by the time he cancelled, every other family accommodation in town was booked out. Therefore, we had no option but to use the other apartment which he owns.
reviews.title: Mornington Apartment Location a dissapointment

reviews.text: Not close to town, a supermarket, a dairy or any other amenities. Without a car you will be stuck here. At the very least a few basic breakfast supplies could be included given that there are no options to purchase nearby.
reviews.title: Awesome apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loud road noise throughout the night caused problems with sleeping.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience with Owner!

reviews.text: Suitable for friends staying together, but not for a family as children's bedroom is 2 floors down from adults. Very steep stairs would also be a problem for those with impaired mobility.
reviews.title: Perhaps Dunedin's Best Stay

description: Chapel Apartments offers a unique accommodation experience. An innovative contemporary design finished to the highest standard housed in an historical building, the oldest church (1863) in Dunedin.
